title: Apple MacBook Pro 17" 2.8GHz core i7, 8GB RAM, anti-glare Laptop
description:
I'm selling my mid-2009 17" MacBook Pro, 2.8GHz core 2 duo with 8GB RAM, a 500GB hard drive, a DVD SuperDrive, eSATA port, and a non-glare screen. 
 
It was purchased in December 2009 and hasn't been used for over a year now as I have an iMac at home and a 13" MBP for travel so it's just been sat on my desk looking forlorn.  
 
Battery holds charge very well no issues with it. The screen is perfect no dead pixels, there are some very minor surface scratches on the underside of the case.  
 
I love the screen size, great for watch TV in bed or editing video on on the go. It's powerful and quick running programs etc. 
 
Used to use it to edit video hence the eSATA port (fastest connector at the time) will include an eSATA card for connection to external eSATA drives as it will still edit fast 2k or reduced res 4k. 
 
The MacBook Pro will be fully erased and with a fresh copy of Snow Leopard (OS X 10.6) you can upgrade to El Capitan OS X 10.11 (the last version it can run) very easily with a quick download. It will power up ready for you to put in your own details as if purchased new. 
 
Will come with charger , eSATA express card and Snow Leopard OS disk. 
 
Any questions just ask.  
 
NOTE I ACCIDENTALLY DROPPED IT ON THE WAY TO SELL AND  NOW NEEDS A NEW LOGIC BOARD FML!!! I'VE LOWERED THE PRICE TO REFLECT THIS.  
 
No damage to the outside from the fall but I took it into apple and they said the logic board will need replacing. This can be done online for about $200 or in store for $500.

title: Apple iMac 20" 2006/max RAM/1TB HDD/upgraded CPU
description:
For Sale: Apple iMac 20-inch, early 2006 
 
Basic specs (details below): 
• 20-inch iMac (MA200LL) released in "early 2006" by Apple 
• CPU upgrade from 2GHz Intel Core Duo to 2GHz Core 2 Duo 
• Maxed out installed memory at 2GB 
• Replaced 250GB hard drive with 1TB drive 
• MacOS 10.6.8 installed along with all other recommended Apple updates. 
• No keyboard; mouse if needed 
• Apple remote control included 
• Mini-DVI to DVI adapter included (for second display) 
 
I have a fully-working iMac I'd like to offer. 
 
Here are a few of the sites that describe it: 
☞ http://support.apple.com/kb/SP35 
☞ http://manuals.info.apple.com/en_US/iMac_Early2006_UG.pdf 
☞ http://www.everymac.com/systems/apple/imac/specs/imac_cd_2.0_20.html 
☞ http://lowendmac.com/2006/20-in-imac-early-2006/ 
 
This is a fully working iMac. Shortly before wiping the drive (zeroed seven times, to the DOD 5220-22-M standard) and a new system reinstalled, I was online using wi-fi and transferring data using Dropbox as well as via a flash drive. I even checked out the DVD drive by watching a bit of The Big Short. After wiping everything I installed MacOS 10.6 (installation DVD included) and upgraded to 10.6.8, which is the final recommended OS for this machine (10.7 is possible, apparently, but most sites don't recommend it.  See the Low End Mac link, above). The screenshot attached was taken just before I erased that installation account and reset the "new-owner experience" toggle. 
 
The built-in display has a resolution of 1680x1050. My second display was a standard 1080p monitor at 1920x1080, but it can display 1920x1200, too. The machine has pretty loud built-in speakers. The "Front Row" app and remote control make it a pretty nice AV machine. 
 
Until a year or so ago, this was my workhorse machine. I had it attached to a second full-sized monitor via the Mini-DVI connection (see image), and more than doubling the screen real estate had no effect. But it is a ten-year-old computer, so trying to do work that requires a dozen tabs to be open as well as sophisticated software will slow it down. I was running a copy of Parallels with Windows to run a Windows-only application as well as word-processing, web browsing, etc., on the Mac side, and it just wasn't up to it.  If you only want to browse the 'net and maybe watch Netflix, Youtube and DVDs, this machine is probably completely adequate. 
 
Upgrades: I followed the instructions on iFixit to replace the internal hard drive with a much larger one at one terabyte. The drive is a Seagate Barracuda LP 1TB HDD, which has very high reviews on Google, Newegg and Amazon, so hopefully will last a long time to come. That's one of the major components of the price I'm charging. 
 
I also followed iFixit's instructions on replacing the CPU with a faster one. The new CPU is a 2GHz Intel Core 2 Duo, code number T7200. (The slightly faster 2.16GHz T7400 or 2.33GHz T7600 weren't available at sensible prices at the time, and given that the difficulty rating of the CPU operation is "very difficult", probably not worth the gain). According to CPU World, the T7200 is typically about 16% faster than the stock T2500 in single-threaded applications, and even faster in multi-threaded applications. If you don't want to process the jargon: I installed this because it was a substantially faster processor. 
 
iFixit guidelines for this model are at: 
☞  https://www.ifixit.com/Device/iMac_Intel_20%22_EMC_2105_and_2118 
CPU comparison at: 
☞  http://www.cpu-world.com/Compare/843/Intel_Core_2_Duo_Mobile_T7200_(Socket_M)_vs_Intel_Core_Duo_T2500_(Socket_M).html 
 
I don't have a spare keyboard to go with this; I need it for the iMac I replaced it with. I'd like to keep the mouse it came with (the peculiar Apple Mighty Mouse--not the one shown in the image) as a backup, but if you really need it I can spare it. Keyboards and mice are pretty cheap, whether on Amazon or at Goodwill. Any USB keyboard or mouse will work with any computer with a USB port, after all. 
 
Possible bonus: I have a bunch of unused writeable CDs and DVDs I'd be happy to include; otherwise I'll give them away for free. The built-in optical drive can burn to these, of course. 
 
I also have a box this is packed in, but it from a later iMac. Still, it makes it easier to lug around. 
 
All of this is located in San Francisco's Lower Haight neighborhood. Drop me a line if you have any questions.

CUT THE CABLE - DITCH THE DISH & CANCEL YOUR NETFLIX, AMAZON PRIME & HULU ACCOUNTS & Surely STOP your trips if you're still going to REDBOX... so last decade!

Watch LIVE SPORTS - even PPV events - FREE!!! (NBA, NFL, NHL, MLB, GOLF, UFC, BOXING and even international sports like soccer and cricket!) 
 
Watch ADULT-XXX from top sites - Yes... - all FREE!!! (YES - with NO monthly fees hitting your credit card!) 
 
*In addition to Free Movies, TV & Live Sporting events... This box turns your ordinary TV into a SUPER SMART TV (think of your TV as a giant tablet!) - check email, Skype loved ones, Watch You-Tube vids, play andriod-based games from the Play Store or stream Pandora! Download any of Androids 1.3 million apps now in the Play Store directly to your TV.... So throw your chromecast, Roku, altered Apple TV, Amazon Fire Stick or similar device away and donate your DVD library to the Goodwill. A "MUST HAVE" for any home theater system!  
 
Stream ANY MOVIE, TV SHOW, ADULT-XXX, LIVE SPORTS, LIVE Premium Channels, etc. Many Movies avl. today are still in theaters! (recently, I've watched The Arrival, Rogue 1, Suicide Squad, Sausage Party, Doctor Strange and Hacksaw Ridge, just to name a few!) Or, use the "search" function and type in your favorite movie ever and the Stealth will instantly pull it up in seconds - *Think about it... the ability to pull up ANY MOVIE you want to watch - instantly, on-demand is PRICELESS! You literally will have free and instant access to the LARGEST MOVIE COLLECTION IN THE WORLD!  
 
PLUG-N-PLAY! *THE ONLY THING REQUIRED IS A HDMI INPUT ON YOUR TV & A GOOD INTERNET CONNECTION (15mbps+) - connect by either Wi-fi -or- Ethernet. *If you're not sure what type of speed you have, contact your internet provider and make sure you are getting at least 15mbps+ download speed (don't worry about the ping or upload speeds). You can also do your own test by visiting speedtest (dot) net  
 
**Don't be fooled by other cheap Android based Boxes with only 1 GB of RAM or less, or altered boxes (Roku, Apple TV or Firestick)!, our SUPER FAST box has double their speed @ 2 GB of RAM & 8 GB of ROM paired with the fastest CPU in the industry, - those altered boxes mentioned above or cheaper 1 GB Android boxes are KNOWN to overheat, then lock up and eventually burn-out after a few months of straining the CPU..., Don't be fooled into buying an inferior box - with this technology, you get what you pay for! *That is the first, but most important of 3 reasons why the Stealth TV Box is SUPERIOR to all other boxes on the market! **The second of the 3 reasons is the amount of add-ons we offer, which is 100+ Add-ons are like apps on your phone. The Stealth comes pre-loaded with 100+ of the top add-ons, so it will take you months to only scratch the surface of this device! ***Lastly, (third of the 3 reasons) is our ongoing support - DO NOT buy a box that some fly-by-night guy that meets you in a coffee shop has no clue what they are selling you, or even up-to-date on this evolving technology... We have been "hands-on" with this technology for over 2 years and will communicate any need to know changes through our YouTube channel at: StealthTVbox/Channel This technology has evolved drastically over the past few years and will continue to evolve and get better with each passing month, so "support" is KEY to stay in tuned with the newest and best add-ons, tips, changes, etc. 
 
Comes in retail box w/instructions - HDMI cord, remote, and power cord. 1 box is needed per TV... but calculate your monthly cable or satellite bill x 12 months (You're probably giving the cable/satellite giants $2,000+/each year so you will see that getting a 2nd or even 3rd box is still worth the one time price tag. Start with 1, this month - get used to it, then add on another box next month, and so on...  
 
Get it on ebay (see our feedback!), or with free shipping on our official website - www.stealthtvbox.com (we have to charge shipping on ebay due to high seller fees we have to pay there) 
 
Best of all... The STEALTH TV BOX is TOTALLY LEGAL! It uses "open-source" software to connect to various servers via the world-wide-web, hence you are NOT "stealing" a particular satellite or cable company feed! Being NO CONTENT is ever downloaded onto your hard drive, our device is nothing more than a mini computer that only "streams" content (never downloads) - thus makes the Stealth legal for us to sell, and you to buy! How is that, you say? On Feb. 26th, 2015 the FCC passed "net neutrality and open internet rules" in consumers favor which make "streaming" in the comfort of your home legal, as long as you are not "downloading" (and redistributing) copyrighted content. Think of it like this - owning a gun is legal, however what you do with it makes all the difference, so play by the FCC rules that state you may "stream" content which is already in, what we call the "internet cloud."  
 
**NOTE: We solely own the Stealth TV Box name, photos and logo(s) so photos are strictly protected and Trade Marked, so please do NOT steal our photos or you will be dealt with accordingly, with legal actions. Thank You!**** Follow us on IG & Twitter @stealthtvbox

title: Mackie DL1608 Digital Mixer with Wi-Fi Router
description:
Digital mixer of the year, the ultra-compact 16-channel 8-bus Mackie DL-1608. Wireless remote control from iPad and iPhone from anywhere in the venue, ton of features that doesn't exist in other analog and digital mixers, and all this fits in a standard laptop bag! 
 
- Excellent ONYX mic preamps, the same as in ONYX-80 series large format analog mixers and ONYX recording interfaces. Accept ANY signal source, from condenser mics to line-level (keyboards, digital drums, iPhone/iPod, CD player, etc.) 
- Full digital control, including scenes memory and recall.  
- 4-band fully parametric EQ and full dynamics suite (compressor, limiter, gate, expander) on each and every input and output. 
- Eight 31-band graphic equalizers with +/- 15dB range (more than typical 12dB), also with unique "Draw" feature (let you draw a desired EQ curve right on iPad, instead of moving each slider separately). 
- Two independent effects processors with all the stuff you may need for a gig: reverbs, delays, etc. 
- Channels and effects preset libraries. Real time saver, you can load typical preset like "Kick drum", "Piano", "Guitar", Female VOX", etc, it gets 90% of job done, then you can tweak it to your taste. 
- Instant one-button two-track or multi-track recording straight to iPad. You can record your event as multitrack session and later polish it in a studio with any DAW (ProTools, Logic, Cubase, etc.) 
- Remote levels control from any iPhone or iPod Touch. You can let musicians dial their own monitor mixes (up to 6 independent mono mixes). This feature is a lifesaver, no more "I can't hear myself in monitors" or "I need more of this and that"). In fact you are getting a full functionality of an Aviom personal monitor mixers for free: everyone has an iPhone today, all you need is to download a free app! 
 
DL1608 can easily handle a typical 4-5 piece band gig (most bands fit into 16-channel grid, even with fully miked drum kit, and never need more than 6 separate monitor mixes). I've done plenty of cover bands with this mixer. 
 
Too many features to list here, read online reviews or download MasterFader app to your iPad and try it in demo mode, it's awesome! New version 4.0 adds bunch of new features: custom channel layers, VCAs, 6-band parametric EQ on outputs, etc. etc.  
 
Also watch MasterFader launch video: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4yCGH5mmGaU 
 
The most comprehensive video tutorial on DL1608 covering the latest MasterFader 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_0OnElTV5oo 
It's an hour long, but covers EVERYTHING, definitely worth watching at least once. 
 
This is 30-pin dock version (for iPad 1 and 2). Can be used with any iPad model, from Mini to Pro (for newer iPads with Lighting connector you can use a 30-pin-to-Lighting adapter ($29 from Apple Store or around $6 on eBay), or just use Wi-Fi connection. (Note that all other iPad-controlled mixers on the market doesn't even have a dock for iPad, Wi-Fi only!). Mixer hardware is identical in both, so they sounds the same. All the sound processing is done inside of DL-1608, iPad is just the controller (also, if you'll lose Wi-Fi connection to the mixer, nothing will happen, it will still pass audio in the state it was left on). 
 
Mixer is in excellent condition, everything works 100%. Selling only the mixer with power supply, iPad is shown just for illustration, how it looks together. Works with all iPad models. Comes with Linksys wireless router, all set up and ready to go. Make sure to download MasterFader app to your iPad before coming if you want to test it (it's also a good way to learn mixer in offline mode). I can test functionality with my iPad if desired. It doesn't take a lot of iPad computing power to work, so the older iPads work fine, and those are dirt cheap today ($100-130 for iPad 2, there's about 400 of them for sale on Craigslist at the moment). 
 
Since you see this ad now, it means the mixer is STILL AVAILABLE

Stock the boutique area with pet food, bones, and purple hair accessories with flowers and bows. When LEGO pets get thirsty, you can pretend to fill the included dog bowl at the salon tap.

title: Bang & Olufsen BeoSystem 2500 - $595 or reasonable best offer
description:
Selling 1991 Bang & Olufsen BeoSystem 2500 stereo with BeoLab 2500 Active Loudspeakers all in excellent condition.   
 
Here is a Video that I shot of the unit loading and playing a CD.  Watch to the end. 
https://vimeo.com/174031642 
 
This unit is complete with a B&O Beolink 1000 Remote Control.  The CD Player and FM work perfectly, including the auto open Glass Doors and Interior Lights.  The Tape Player does not work, but who plays tapes. For $30 you can purchase a high quality adapter to connect the B&O 2500 to your phone directly or to an Apple Airport Express to Stream Music wirelessly.  http://www.ebay.com/itm/6ft-3-5mm-Stereo-Step-Down-Plug-to-DIN-7-Bang-Olufsen-Audio-Cable-BO-806Z-/391316071127 
 
This unit was completely serviced in 2007 by Bang & Olufsen, including New Door Belt, Cleaned and Lubricated.  New CD Clamper and Capstan Belt. 
 
Wave your hand in front of the 2500 and the two glass doors slide horizontally apart and a diffuse interior light brightens. The open doors expose the CD player at the top, the control panel with its 40 small identical rectangular buttons in the center.  A small amber display above the buttons indicates source, radio station and other settings. Several seconds after you load your CD, or make your radio-station choice, the glass doors silently slide closed and the light dims.  
 
The sliding glass doors aren`t the only parts of the BeoSystem 2500 that work like magic. Press the ``load`` button and the CD clamping mechanism gracefully rises, allowing you to place a CD on the spindle. Press CD or one of the numbered keys to lower the clamp and start the disc spinning. Very few players use the spinning disc as a design element as the 2500 does. The CD player contains the same programming features as most other CD players, such as being able to program 20 tracks in any order. The circuitry uses dual 16-bit digital-to-analog converters. While this bucks the industry trend toward single-bit converters, the D/A chips that B&O has chosen are of high quality and sound excellent. 
 
BeoSystem 2500 Product Specifications:

Selling Sharpening Stones, made by DMT. Diamond Sharpening type. Each stone has 2 different grades of coarseness. Buy 2 stones and you have coarse to fine to extra fine covered. Start with the Coarse Blue & Fine Red color, then use the Fine Red & Extra Fine Green to get your knife paper cutting sharp. If your knife is dull, you should start with the Coarse Blue color first, then proceed through the other 2 grades. All it takes is 10 - 20 passes per side and it will be sharp again. No oil or water required. Water is recommended but you can also use them dry. These open like a multi tool and fold into a plastic covering. Very easy to use and only requires a few minutes. If you can cut an apple, you can sharpen your knives. Hold the knife at at a 22 degree angle, half of a 45 degree angle, and slice the stone like you would cut an apple. Buy 2 pieces for $70 and you get 3 levels of coarseness and 4 different sides which will cover all your sharpening needs or I can sell you a single Coarse/Fine Stone for $35 since I have 2 of these in single pieces. These sharpening stones can be used to sharpen: Scissors, Poultry Shears, Paring Knife, Utility Knife, Router Bit, Sport Knife, Floral Knife, Pruner, Lopper, Hatchet, Ax, Spade, Shovel 
 
COARSE Blue - Quickly restores a dull edge to cutting sharp again. Customers that desire cutting fast action without worry of edge refinement often use our coarse models. Color code: coarse (45 micron, 325 mesh) "blue". 
 
FINE Red - Restores to a fine edge any knife or tool that is slightly dull. Many of our customers consider the fine grit to be a medium/all purpose sharpener. Professional Chefs and gourmet cooks prefer using our fine grit models. For woodworkers and sportsman who are stepping through the grits, it is the edge refinement step done before micro beveling and polishing. Color code: fine (25 micron, 600 mesh) "red". 
 
EXTRA FINE Green - Refines and polishes the sharp edge to razor sharp perfection. If you are new to sharpening or if you do not need your knife or tool edge to be as sharp as absolutely possible, this grit is not recommended. title: Like New Panasonic 55" Plasma TV (This One's A Keeper!)
description:
You are going to love this 55" TV the moment you set eyes on it. Why is this special? 
 
1) Most of the other plasma's you will see on CL are smaller than 55" 
2) Most of the other plasmas on CL that *are* this size are not Panasonics. Look it up, Panasonic Plasma's have THE BEST picture, better than Samsung, too. But if you're looking at this, you already know that. 
3) Why an older model TV? Because plasmas stopped being produced in ~2013 and to this date no LED LCD TV has come close to matching the picture - the only exception being the brand new OLEDs, which come really close. Go ahead and buy one if you have have $2500-3500 burning a hole in your pockets. 
4) Even the best new LCDs struggle to match the blacks that this TV can produce. Look it up! LCDs produce washed out blacks that are not truly black. If that doesn't bother you, go buy that new TV from Costco. I ain't mad. 
5) This TV has NEVER, EVER been turned onto its side. If you're looking at this plasma, then you know your TV being turned on its side can damage the picture. I bet few or even none of those other CL listings even mentioned that. Extra special care was always taken with this baby. NO scratches or dents. We take care of our stuff! 
 
You're looking at this listing because you know plasma produces the best picture. This TV has more HDMI ports than most of those new LCDs you see being sold in Costco or Walmart as well. Hook up your Apple TV/Amazon Fire TV, PS4, X-Box One, and Wii U all at the same time and see them in all their full HD 1080p glory. It also comes with the original remote, which is way less cluttered than Samsung's remotes. 
 
Worried about your TV monitoring you and invading your privacy with that silly Smart TV crap? Guess what? This TV has no microphone to record your voice and no camera to snoop in on you while you watch. This is the TV you want. Your search has ended. 
 
Why am I selling it if I love it so much? I just bought a 2013 65" Panasonic Plasma, the last of its kind and the top of the line model they offered. That's right, I didn't waste $3k on an OLED. It's time for me to sell this to a person/family that will enjoy it as much as I have. 
 
Seriously interested? I'll throw in a free wall mount made specifically for this TV. It also comes with its original TV stand. 
 
Price is firm, but you're getting one hell of a deal. Need specs? Hit me up, but chances are you already know how dope this TV is.

title: Smart Meter and Smart Grid documentary DVD film - Take Back Your Power
description:
We are offering the smart meter / smart grid documentary DVD Take Back Your Power: Investigating the "Smart" Grid, description below. It is brand new and factory sealed, and we are offering this film to help raise awareness. Two ways to purchase, in person in Monterey or can buy from us on Amazon. For buying in person the film is $15 which is a slight discount from our Amazon price (bulk orders can receive greater discount, email to inquire). Email if interested in buying in person, or the link to buy from us online at Amazon is listed below. Note that the version of this film listed here and on Amazon is the Updated 2014 edition (1st picture), but we also offer the original director's cut version of this film too (3rd picture). 
 
Take Back Your Power - Official Trailer 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kXDFllquOMw 
 
Editorial Review: 
Utility companies are replacing electricity, gas and water meters worldwide with new generation "smart" meters at an unprecedented rate. Take Back Your Power investigates the benefits and risks of this ubiquitous "smart" grid program, with insight from insiders, expert researchers, politicians, doctors, and environmentalists. Transparency advocate Josh del Sol takes us on a journey of revelation and discovery, as we question corporate practice which tap our private information and erode our rights in the name of "green". What you discover will surprise you, unseltte you, and inspire you to challenge the status quo. Features appearances by: Thomas A Drake (Former Senior Executive, NSA), Edward Snowden (NSA whistleblower), Michael Mitcham, Jerry Day, Jeffrey Armstrong (Former Apple executive) and Foster Gamble (creator Thrive) and many others. 
 
Buy from us on Amazon here: 
 
Take Back Your Power: Investigating the "Smart" Grid - Updated 2014 Edition 
http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00LEUA6O0/sr=1-4/qid=1449858209/ref=olp_product_details?ie=UTF8&me=&qid=1449858209&sr=1-4

title: Boxee
description:
Brand new condition with remote. Used a couple of times. Dont use anymore. Have free cable now. 
 
Product Description 
We get it -- you want to the freedom to watch whatever you want on your TV: Movies, TV Shows, Sports, but also any other video that is available online. You want to do it without having to connect a computer to your TV or use a keyboard and mouse. We're all over it. The Boxee Box by D-Link: watch, organize, share -- you are now in full command of your TV for the first time. No rules, no contracts. 
 
The Boxee Box at a glance. 
Superconnected 
 
Not only is Boxee the best way to watch movies, TV shows and clips from the Internet on your TV, it's the easiest. All you need is a TV with an HDMI input and an Internet connection, and Boxee Box will take care of the rest. Equipped with an SD card slot, two USB ports, an optical digital audio connector, HDMI output, and an 802.11n Wi-Fi-equipped Ethernet port, there isn't much Boxee Box can't plug into. 
 
Easy access to Netflix (view larger). 
Stream Your Favorite Flicks in a Flash! 
Put your car keys away. And prepare for a serious couch party. Because the Boxee Box is amped and ready for instant streaming from Netflix. Your favorite blockbusters. Timeless classics. Gotta-see TV. Netflix delivers all these and more by the thousands -- with no late fees. And the Boxee Box pipes it all right into your living room -- on demand, with just a few clicks of the remote! With a one month free trial for new members, you'll be able to instantly watch unlimited TV episodes and movies as often as you want, anytime you want. You'll be hooked before you know it! 
And this isn't just your everyday Netflix, but the new Netflix 3.0, providing better navigation and movie selection options, along with a cooler interactive experience overall. You'll not only find what you want faster. With Netflix's unique LoLoMo (Lists of Lists of Movies) recommendations, you may discover your next watch-till-you-drop favorite served up on a silver platter. And many titles are available in HD. You are so done with long lines and pricey theater tickets! 
 
Full HD movie rentals from VUDU. 
Now HD Has a Whole New Meaning 
Four words: On-Demand HD Library. It doesn't get any better. With over 3000 HD movies and TV titles to choose from you'll never have to leave your couch again -- except for the occasional popcorn refill. Stream hundreds of new releases the same day they come out on DVD. With the convenience of the VUDU app on the Boxee Box, you'll be on Cloud 9 -- and trust us you're not going to want to come down. The best part? You only pay for what you watch, so kiss those late fees goodbye!With VUDU you have instant access to the largest HD collection available anywhere, yeah that's big. The bestest part -- movies in HDX. That's the creme de la creme of HD, the True Cinematic Experience -- 1080p and Dolby Digital plus 5.1 surround sound. Watching movies at home just got more exciting. Lean back -- see VUDU in all its amazingness on your HDTV with the click of a button.  
 
The Internet gives you the freedom to watch what you want, and the power to choose what you want to pay for. It's awesome. What's not awesome about the internet: no big screen, no HD, no home theater experience, no easy interface designed to sift through the mountains of TV shows, Movies, and content available online. And the real killer: no remote. If only there was a little box that brought the freedom of the Internet to your HDTV in stunning 1080p, Dolby Surround Sound, and had a slick interface to simplify everything and -- wait for it -- a remote to put it all at the tips of your fingers. Too bad nobody has thought of that yet. Oh wait, we did. Haha! Ahem... 
 
The Boxee Box, by D-Link, featuring our ingenious two-faced remote. Say goodbye to hunting and pecking for letters on screen, the Boxee Box remote comes with a full QWERTY keypad -- as soon as you start typing Boxee Box's autosearch function starts finding. 
 
Remote app for iPhone and Android devices. 
Use Your iPhone or Android Device as a Remote 
We think our two-sided, QWERTY enabled Boxee remote is pretty darn cool, but hey maybe you lose it, or maybe you just like the stuff you already got. No biggie! Use your iPhone or Android-powered device as a remote with the Boxee Box, and get all the cool functions you're accustomed to. Use your voice to search and use multiple phones as remotes. Boom! 
Send video from your iPad to your TV  
via the Boxee Box. 
Send to Boxee Box 
Watching video on your iPad and want it on the big screen? Send videos straight to your TV via a Boxee Box so everyone in your living room can enjoy. Now you can go back to playing Angry Birds on the iPad while you watch. 
Setup? No Biggie! 
Plug your Boxee Box into the wall, connect it to your TV's HDMI input and turn your Boxee Box on. Oh, please turn on your TV too, thanks. Make sure your TV is getting the signal from the correct HDMI input -- if it is, you'll see Boxee smiling at you :). Grab the remote and follow the on-screen instructions, and that's it! The Boxee Box will automatically configure your internet connection, tune itself to your home entertainment system, and get you up and running in a flash. Already a Boxee user? Schweeet!! The Boxee Box will automatically import your account. No Biggie!! 
 
Intuitive search (see larger image). 
Insta-search-ability 
Say goodbye to hunting and pecking for letters on screen, the Boxee Box Remote features an easy to-use navigation button on the front and a full QWERTY keyboard for text input on the back. Quickly and easily input URLs and account information. With its Smart Auto search function, as soon as you start typing, Boxee Box starts finding. 
 
See What Your Friends Are Watching 
One of the greatest things about the Boxee Box is that if you can't find something to watch, you've got your friends to turn to. Stop watching the same stuff over and over. With the Boxee Box, your friends can see what you've been watching and give fresh recommendations from Facebook, Twitter, and the Boxee network. 
And it goes both ways. If its on Boxee and you like it, you can recommend it to anyone -- TV shows, amateur youtube videos, movies, and more. With the Boxee Box, you're pretty much free to be that guy: recommend anything you've ever watched to everyone. 
 
Never be limited by what you can watch and when. The Boxee Box makes it easy to choose the TV shows you want to watch, and most importantly, the ones you want to pay for. And with over 40,000 TV episodes from your favorite networks instantly available -- that's a lot to choose from. The Office, Family Guy, Entourage, True Blood, and much more. 
 
If we can't find it for free, the Boxee Box will connect you with premium options who can, instantly. Get tons of free stuff, and never pay for the stuff you don't want to watch. Easy. 
 
YouTube on Your Tube 
If you can watch it on your computer's web browser you can watch it on the Boxee Box, only better. Our browser is similar to IE or Safari, but optimized to work with a QWERTY remote and your HDTV, seamlessly. University courses, panel discussions, TED Talks, Current TV, Stanford Online, FORA.tv, whatever -- the Boxee Box delivers all your favorite web-videos and web-only content, no matter how obscure they may be, straight to your TV set. 
 
Get Into the Game 
Why sit on the sidelines when the Boxee Box offers apps to ring the bell of even the most diehard sports fan? Start by taking a courtside seat with NBA.com. Follow your favorite teams. Watch video highlights and get live game updates. Or check out player stats, and sift through league standings. Big on baseball? If so, MLB.TV is a guaranteed homer. Now you can keep up with every club, and be the hero of the block by hosting all the out-of-market games, live and on demand. As for those who need a good slap shot to send them off, NHL GameCenter LIVE is all that and a bag of peanuts. Watch up to 40 live out-of-market games every week. Plus, get unlimited access to the NHL Vault, featuring condensed and full-length replays of over 100 classic NHL games. If you've been in the bull pen too long, let the Boxee Box put you right in the middle of the action. 
 
Hundreds of Your Favorite Apps, Optimized for Your HDTV 
Netflix, Pandora, MLB, NHL, Flickr, Facebook, Vimeo... With Boxee Box, your favorite Apps have been optimized to be enjoyed from the comfort of your couch. We're adding new apps everyday and already have hundreds to choose from. Sit back and put your feet up, because with our remote your favorite Apps are now at the tips of your fingers. 
 
Give Your Wallet a Break 
Think about it: your cable bill is probably about $80 or more per month. You get 500 channels -- some are great, most have a ton of commercials, and you only watch a handful of them. The Boxee Box model is simple: Buy the Boxee Box once, and get instant access to all the entertainment the web has to offer, forever. No rules. No contracts. No monthly fees. If we can't find it for free, the Boxee Box connects you with premium options that can, instantly. Man, we should've started doing this years ago. 
 
Not only does the Boxee Box give you access to thousands of TV shows and movies from all over the Internet, it takes your personal video, picture and music files from your hard drive and home network somewhere they've never been -- your HDTV. The Boxee Box works with virtually any file type (MP3, MP4, .jpeg, .avi, .mkv) and makes it easier to sort through than ever. If you can create it, the Boxee Box will play and organize it. Automatically download all relevant artwork and info and simplify all your digital stuff with big, colorful thumbnail photos in a TV-friendly interface you can access with a remote. You're friends will be impressed, or jealous. Probably jealous. 
 
Turn Your TV Into a Jukebox You Can Share 
Your MP3 files are organized and simplified and ready to share with your friends, anywhere on the Boxee network. And with our Pandora App, you can create unlimited radio stations by genre, artist, or song you can also share from the comfort of your couch. 
 
The Box Connected 
Leave the computer and mouse on your desk. The Boxee Box instantly streams thousands of TV shows and movies from the Internet in glorious Full HD 1080p and Dolby Surround Sound. It's just another in a long line of innovative home networking solutions from D-Link. 
 
http://www.amazon.com/Boxee-D-Link-Streaming-Media-Player/dp/B0038JE07O

title: iHome Kineta K2 Stereo Alarm Clock
description:
- BRAND NEW - never opened  
Stream wireless audio from your compatible Bluetooth-enabled devices with the Kineta K2 Stereo Alarm Clock from iHome.  
The K2 utilizes Bluetooth and NFC technology for streaming audio from compatible mobile devices. Additionally, it features an FM tuner and an AUX port for line-in audio, meaning you can listen to music from almost any source.  
The K2 features a removable K-CELL battery that functions as a battery pack and charger for your USB-compatible devices; those same devices can be charged using the K2's built-in USB charging port.  
 
Asking $60 
Email or text Conner at

description:
Wireless ready and HDMI included.. 
Have a crystal clear HD picture as large as 35ft. Diagonally or as small as 30" and as clear as LCD TV... 
 
Pictures taken are of actual projected image from this projector "true 1080p HD screenshot". 
 
PANASONIC PT-F300Ultra. Panasonic with 4200 Lumens (Ultra Bright) Can be watched during the daylight hours or with lights on. Also can be used outdoor and for events... Can produce a projected image as large as 30 feet diagonally (almost as big as a drive in movie), or as small as 32 inches.... Depending on your needs. 
Completely sealed housing and lens.... and easy enough that "children can operate" 
 
Still one of the best on the market. 
 
It is HDMI ready and professional grade.. 
 
Comes with: Rolling carrying case....Factory remote...users manual...cables....cords.....installed lamp.... And....6ft x 7ft vinyl screen with eyelets 
 
It has a 360 degree rotational lens shift (completely child friendly and very easy to use), 10,000 hour filter cartridge (no maintenanc) 5000 hour lamp life (about 3,500 hours still remaining on the bulb), daylight switch option (so you can watch with lights on or curtains open, rolling case and all of the cables and cords (HDMI INPUT, VGA , DVI, S-video, RCA, CAT 5 for direct modem hookup. Awesome for home theater or even large events. It can project a small image ( 25" diagonal ), or as big as a drive in movie ( 50 feet diagonal ), and it's "SUPER BRIGHT" (4,200 lumens). 
 
Works with Sattellite , Comcast Cable, Direct T.V, and basically anything with a video output. It Works with desktop computers as well as laptops (Mac and Windows), IPads, Most Tablets, 
It also works wirelessly with "Apple T.V., Netgear Push T.V., and Chromecast. It also displays internet T.V. And you can use it with IPhone, Android phones as well as most "pay as you go phones" (t-mobile, metro pcs... Etc..). 
 
Plug and play ready. You can just hook it up and start watching today...It is bright enough to watch during the day with lights on, or outside on o screen up to 50 feet diagonally. 
 
It originally cost over $4,000.00 
 
 
It is crystal clear ,very bright and looks like new..
